topic.title: I need somebody for my blog on ZeroNet!
topic.body: I have a blog on ZeroNet i need somebody for make articles on ZeroNet and On my forum someone iterested?

topic.title: On zeronet is possible clone a website?
topic.body: if i make a blog somebody can clone my site?

2_13BepSu3vkeSQB3ZWkCDg7Lu5w64tfpeTa.body:
> [ks](#comment_45_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): Only if you set {"cloneable": true} in the site's content.json file.

thank you!

> [ks](#comment_45_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): Only if you set {"cloneable": true} in the site's content.json file.

And what happen if i clone the folder?

> [ks](#comment_46_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): If you set “{"cloneable": false}” there will be no “clone” item for your site in ZeroHello. If said option is set to true, obviously people can clone the site in ZeroHello.
> I don't understand what you mean by “cloning the folder”.

if you go on the folder datas of zeronet there are a lot of website is it possible to clone from here

> [pycole](#comment_100_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Pretending to be another website (phishing) is possible on the normal internet too; there are tools available for downloading sites. The best way to deal with the problem either way is by bookmarking urls.
> On ZN, we have a slight advantage, though. If you've already visited a site, you can browse it easily. If a new 'fake' site is made and you are lead there by a link, It'll need to find peers and download. Hopefully, You'll be thinking 'wait a sec, I already downloaded this site!' and be suspicious.

i now but in ZeroNet is more simple
